author: NEW YORK DAILY NEWS
title: Instagram released new Boomerang app, creates looping videos
text:
Instagram Instagram has introduced a new app that recreates Live Photos called "Boomerang." Instagram Users can share their videos on Instagram or Facebook. Previous Next Enlarge Instagram is adding a new app to its collection and it's called Boomerang .
The company's new video app will let users turn a burst of photos into one second looping videos, which somewhat resemble a GIF.
"Today, we're announcing Boomerang from Instagram, a new video app that lets you turn everyday moments into something fun and unexpected," Instagram wrote in a blog post.
To capture a video, users just have to tap the capture button and the app takes care of the rest. Videos, or Boomerangs, will automatically save to the phone's camera roll.
The app obviously works best when trying to capture a moving item or person. For example, users can capture a friend performing a cartwheel or a car zooming by.
Boomerangs are also very similar to Apple's Live Photos , which capture moving items in real time and recreates them as moving images.
This is the third app Instagram releases to enhance users' experience. The first was Hyperlapse and the second was Layout , which lets users create borderless collages.
Boomerang is available for both iOS and Android beginning Oct. 23.
